parsed.internal_thinking:
I have placed my first settlement on Node 42, which is an extremely strong production spot for Wheat and Ore (Wh9, Wh9, O5). This gives me 12 pips of production focused on late-game resources, ideal for building cities and buying development cards. However, I currently lack Wood, Brick, and Sheep. My road placement should facilitate expansion toward these missing resources to balance my economy.

Analyzing the directions from Node 42:
1. Toward Node 41: This path leads toward Node 31 (Wh9, B10, W11) and Node 40 (O5, B10, Wood Port). Node 31 offers much-needed Brick and Wood. Node 40 provides a Wood port (W2), which would be incredibly valuable given my high Wheat/Ore production—I can trade surplus Wheat for Wood at a 2:1 rate.
2. Toward Node 43: This leads to Node 43 (Wh9, Wh6, Wh9) and Node 44 (O2, Wh9, Wh6). While these are high-pip nodes (13 and 10 pips respectively), they provide redundant resources (more Wheat and Ore).
3. Toward Node 50: This leads to the 3:1 ports at Node 50 and 51.

Choosing the road to 41 is the most strategic move as it provides a clear path to diversify my resource base and secure a useful port. My second settlement will ideally be placed at Node 12 (W3, B6, S5) to secure Sheep and better Wood/Brick numbers, but this road ensures my first settlement has a strong expansion path.
parsed.note_to_self: My first settlement at 42 is a Wheat/Ore powerhouse. I'm heading toward Node 41 to eventually reach the Wood Port at 40 and the Brick/Wood at 31. My second settlement MUST target Node 12 (W3, B6, S5) or Node 5 (W4, S8, B6) to get consistent Wood/Brick/Sheep production. Alice already has Wood/Brick/Sheep, so I need to secure my share before Charlie takes the remaining good spots.
parsed.say_outloud: Decided to point my road toward the coast. I'm hoping to set up some trade routes early on to make up for the resources I'm missing. Good luck everyone!
